Nestled between majestic beech forests, at the northern end of the s-train line from Copenhagen,
is the main regional centre and transport hub of
. For visitors, this small city of some 30.000 inhabitants is above all known for its large impressive renaissance castle.

Ever since the first railway reached the city in 1864, Hillerød has been the main transportation hub of the region. Since then a number of small railways has been build to connect the city with nearly all the towns of North Zealand, and the railway station is filled to the brim with commuters during rush hour peaks.

value: Hillerød station is the north end of the S-train system Line

and Hillerød through central Copenhagen. Leaves every 10 minutes during weekdays, and every 20 minutes in the evening and on weekends. Journey time is about 40 minutes between Hillerød and Copenhagen central station.
: Less frequent private railroads leaves Hillerød for;
, the two latter are both close to some excellent beaches.

Almost all cities north of Hillerød are served by buses from the train station, below are some of the more useful lines for tourists.

value: runs between Hillerød and Hundige via Roskilde, for access to the world heritage site Roskilde Cathedral, and the Viking Ship museum
leaves about every hour on weekdays to Frederikssund by Roskilde Fjord.
Runs on the highway between Hillerød and Rungsted station near Øresund, on the
line, the Louisiana art museum is two stops on Kystbanen from Rungsted.

From the station follow the signs down Vibekevej to the city.

There is a small ferry that goes between the castle and the main square, DKK 25.

value: directions=15 minutes walk, from the station follow the signs down Vibekevej, or use bus 301 or 302 (they both go in two opposite directions from the station, so ask if it goes to the castle)

Build by Frederik II in 1560. Inside you can see the church, the halls, displays of old paintings. On the third floor is the modern collection with portraits and painting from 20th century Danish history.

value: content=Do not miss the Baroque gardens started in 1720.
For a day of castles, you can combine this with a visit to
, by catching the small private railway that runs between Hillerød and
on the way. If you're visiting from Copenhagen, it is possible to return from
content=Museum of local history for the last 600 years.

content=In the old electric plant from the turn of the 20th century the museum administration has set up a nice temporary exhibition space with changing, but long-term, exhibitions, mainly themed around local history.

content=A mini open-air museum which is mainly used in live history mediation for local schools. Its not meant to be a public museum but if you're really interested call the museum at +45 48 24 34 48 to organize a tour

content=The ruins of the largest medieval Augustinian abbey in the Nordic countries. The small museum on the grounds, has exhibitions about the medical history of the Augustinian order, including a garden with medical herbs, and some 300 skeletons on display! Once every year there is a middle age themed market day held, at the grounds around mid June.

content=Exhibition space in a beautiful neoclassical building from 1783, part of the building is occupied by the local Art Society which holds changing art exhibits and vernissages throughout the year.
content=Art gallery primarily exhibiting local painters.

content=This group has turned a 80,000 sq m area on the outskirts of Hillerød, into a fun adventure park, with a 1 km mountain bike track, numerous paintball scenarios, obstacle courses, tree climbing etc. Mainly caters to groups.
content=Indoor swimmingpool with a 50 meter pool, 3 waterslides and springboards. Also have Reflexology and Massage avilable if you prebook.
content=A cultural venue with treater performances and concerts and small art exhibitions in an old iron foundry.

There are many options for souvenirs near the castle.

value: content=An impressive selection of woollen sweaters
hours=M-F 10AM-7PM, Sa 10AM-4PM, first Su every month 11AM-4PM
content=Shopping center with more than 50 shops.  The architecture and design are not as terrible as often seen.
content=Custom built radios with funky designs. They make excellent gifts and are relatively cheap for Denmark.
price=Buffet 99 Kr, three course menu 199 Kr
content=Solid Italian food and quality wines, with the Italian chef singing in the kitchen. A little to the expensive side, but a cozy place.
price=Open sandwiches from 48 Kr, mains 168-188 Kr
content=Danish cuisine focusing on open sandwiches for lunch.
content=Good lunch in a historical setting on the castle ground, next to the lake.
content=This is a tea/coffee salón where you can enjoy warm drinks with a baked product of your choice. If you are in need of something more substantial, there's grilled ham & cheese sandwich.

All the places listed below are on the main pedestrianized street running through the center. Expect mainstream pop music at all the places below, for a city this close to the capital the nightlife scene here is rather provincial, on the other hand it is usually a lively experience.

value: content=This long time favorite with the local high school students, gets rather crammed in the weekends. But usually a good atmosphere albeit rather youngish. Also doubles as the normal cafe during daylight.
price=Cover charge 50 DKK, Draft beer 35 DKK

content=This place is a cafe and eating place until it transforms itself to a pub around 7PM, has a lovely outdoor terrace in the summer, and hosts occasional jazz nights. Weekend nights the place takes a name change to 'Club Annabell' and doubles as nightclub. The minimum age of 21, keeps the usual soldiers and high school students away.
content=Good sized place on the central square, occasionally breaks the monotony of mainstream pop although if the techno replacement is any better, you'll have to judge.
directions=Buses 701 or 702 to the 'Frederiksgade' stop follow it, and turn down 'Åmosevej'
price=70 DKK for tent, or 270 for a small cabin
content=Camping grounds located quite close to the city center, also has small spartan cabins 7 sq m or 14 sq m with room for 2 to 4 people.
price=160 DKK for dorm (only in summer) Rooms from 325 w/o bath
content=A large hostel in the forest on the outskirts of Hillerød, has bikes for hire.
content=Cozy and comfortable bed and breakfast in natural surroundings.
directions=turn left after you exit the station, continue across the Intersection down Milnersvej
content=The city's only proper hotel, there is a quite good restaurant in the basement.
